dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you? Do you care about me?

dialogues.speaker: JOHANNA
dialogues.text: I don't care about anyone, Thomas, remember? They both look up to the ceiling, until...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I wish I knew you then. When you were innocent. And this resonates with her. Makes her angry. As she gets up... covers herself with the sheet.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANNA
dialogues.text: See Thomas, that's the problem with men. You all want to fall in love with Elaine Robinson... (and then) but you just end up fucking her mother. EXT. AVE A вЂ” NIGHT W.F. and Thomas enjoy a brisk night stroll through the do cum-hipster streets of Alphabet City. W.F. It's a reference from "The Graduate."

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I don't understand her. Why isn't she... softer? W.F. Thomas, people are not always clean and happy. People are layered and wounded and fragile.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Do you think Johanna is any of those? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: W.F.
dialogues.text: I quite sure she's all of those. Thomas just stares at W.F. for a long beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Your litmus test. W.F. stops. W.F. Yes, I didn't finish. My litmus test of love. 66. W.F. lights up a cigar. Resumes his earlier reminiscence.

dialogues.speaker: W.F., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If I knew for sure that I was in love with Karen then I would disconnect her and Benny from my life. The thing is... I had no idea if I really loved her or not W.F. starts walking again. Thomas at his side.

dialogues.speaker: W.F., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It happened by accident actually. You know the fountain in Washington Square Park? Thomas does. W.F. remembers fondly...

dialogues.speaker: W.F., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It was a very clear night with the kind full moon you could read by. We stopped at that fountain. There were a few people milling about but it was basically ours. And I asked her to dance.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: To dance? W.F. Yes. There was no music but we danced there. And it came to me. It was so clear. I loved her

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: So your litmus test requires a visit to Washington Square Park. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk in silence. Thomas digesting it. (2)

dialogues.speaker: W.F.
dialogues.text: By a bright moon, yes.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: And Karen? W.F. That was the last night I ever talked to her.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: How long ago was this? W.F. Eighteen days... Thomas stops, looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: W.F., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: four months and twenty two years. 67. Then... INT. THE WEBB RIVERSIDE DRIVE BROWNSTONE вЂ” NIGHT A dinner party of about sixteen with familiar faces. Thomas sits at the head of the table.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Boss Tweed took care of his constituents, he was a fall guy.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: He was a crook. A dirty criminal. He robbed the city dry. Thomas looks across the table to where his father sits. Nathan looks distracted.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: And Robert Moses- -

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Impatiently playing with his food. Robert Moses gave us that beautiful park across the street. Robert Moses built this city.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: He was an egomaniac. Barbara chimes in. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Did anybody read Seymour Hersh's scathing satirical piece on the new designs for Lincoln Center? Anna picks it up...

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: IsnвЂ™t the new architect from India? Because I saw this wonderful documentary on outsourcing. Nathan bangs his fist on table.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: I can't take it! Everybody quiets and looks over to Nathan.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This dinner party has been recycled a thousand times over. Doesn't anybody see that? Nathan stands. Circles the table.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: George and David's perpetual argument over Boss Tweed versus Robert Moses. Barbara's constant references to the current New Yorker. Anna's claims to have read or watched whatever was hawked on Charlie Rose the night before. Judith stands, puts a comforting hand on Nathan's arm.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: Darling... what's wrong? Nathan swipes away her arm.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: This! We're all dying... dying. And to ease the pain we eat together and talk about things that we think are important.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: You need to lay down. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: No! I need to get out of here. Nathan announces to the group of shocked party guests.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry but this isn't working anymore. Thomas looks on wide-eyed as Nathan storms out. And Judith... shaking... apologizing... mortified. INT. KITCHEN вЂ” NIGHT Judith chain smokes. She's in a state.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: He hasn't been eating. He's stopped reading at night. He just stares at the wall. I think we should cancel the Kenta-Webb anniversary party. Tears in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm the sick one. Not him. Thomas just stands there. Paralyzed.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And I think he's in love with someone else.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Mom, don't be ridicules.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: It's true. We try to protect our children from our limitations but... You're old enough now. Thomas sucks in an uncomfortable breath. Then...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Mom, do you read in the Starbucks on Ninety-fourth?

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: Yes, why? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: It seems weird. This is a big house. Why don't you read here?

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: They have good coffee.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: You just don't seem like one of those people whose apartments close in on them every night so they end up at Starbucks.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: Well, sometimes a big place is even worse. Judith shakily lights another cigarette off her last

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I wonвЂ™t make it. Without him, I won't make it. Thomas moves toward his mother, trying to be comforting.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Mom, don't talk like that. Crying now.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: Don't you see... it's all falling apart. EXT. BROOKLYN BRIDGE вЂ” NIGHT W.F. and Thomas stand under the first storied arch. Manhattan twinkles to one side, Brooklyn to the other. It's late, no people. wW.F. chomps on his cigar. W.F. Do you think he's in love with her?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I'm in love with her. W.F. Is he? As Thomas stops and ponders the illuminated dotted skylin (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I think so. W.F. You and your father are suffering from the same disease.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Johanna. They resume their stroll.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How come you're writing about me? W.F. Because that's what I do. I write about people I know and thinly veil it by giving them different names and professions.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: But why me? W.F. Because your story interests me. Look, I got the apartment to get out of the house and write this completely other story but it just didn't come across. Thomas looks back over to W.F.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: And mine did. W.F. Yes. Like everything good, it happened by accident. I had writer's block. I met you. Now, I have three hundred and nine pages. Thomas accepts that. They walk in silence, until...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: My father's publishing house is throwing an anniversary party tomorrow night... will you come? W.F. Why? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: You've heard about all these people but you've never met them. It'll help your book. It's a hot event Will you come? W.F. I don't know. Thomas walks off into the night...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I'll leave the invitation at your door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cab pulls up out in front of the old tenement building waits. Dressed down but done up, Mimi emerges and runs ou to the cab. INT. CAB вЂ” NIGHT Mimi gets in and smiles to Thomas. No greeting, no words, just a smile. They ride in silence. Until... Mimi takes his hand, kisses him on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: You look nice. And she doesn't let go of his hand.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I thought you never turn. She whispers into his ear.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: We only turn when you turn away. It's maddening. As he looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Then we're never looking at each other. INT. THE RAINBOW ROOM вЂ” NIGHT At the top of Rockefeller Plaza. The view is incredible. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Mimi and Thomas step out of the elevator into the swingin event. The literati energy buzzing palpable. Commerce meets art. Some are in longhairs in Chuck Taylor while others are polished in Prada. The kind of party whe poignant philosophical debates occupy the same table as superficial book deals. Everybody's drunk. Everybody's table-hoping. Everybody's fabulous. A quiet jazz band provides the music. Judith and Nathan hold court with some of the partygoers. Thomas stops and looks at them. Mimi at his side.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: They look so happy.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Doesn't everyone here? Mimi looks around smiles. This is her vibe.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: Thomas. Mimi. Thomas and Mimi join his parent's group.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You remember David Remnick. They join the conversation while Nathan throws on a plast smile and goes to greet another partygoer Thomas takes in the party... sees a familiar face at the Heads over to it.

dialogues.speaker: W.F. GERALD
dialogues.text: swirls his Scotch around in the glass as he stands next t the bar... in the shadows... out of everybody's eyesight.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Thanks for coming. W.F. It's a great party.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: It always is. There's Mimi talking with my mother. Thomas points over to Mimi. W.F. takes them in. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: W.F.
dialogues.text: She's beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I told you she was. W.F. I was talking about your mother

dialogues.speaker: AND JUDITH
dialogues.text: talking to a circle of partygoers with Mimi in it. She's on a healthy face, full of life, entertaining them all wi some story. Thomas joins and waits patiently. Judith finishes. Thomas grabs her attention.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I want you to meet someone. He leads both his mother and Mimi toward the bar.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: Who are we meeting, Thomas? As Thomas arrives at the bar. Looks around.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: My new friend. W.F. is nowhere to be found.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He was just here. Judith sees someone she knows and heads to greet them.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: We'll meet him later, Dear. Thomas is left with Mimi.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: He was just here. As Mimi simply shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: AND JOHANNA
dialogues.text: martini in her hand... alone... pondering the buildings b that line 5th avenue. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Somebody now stands at her side. W.F. "I have looked down upon the city from high windows. It is then that the great buildings lose reality and take on magical powers. Squares and squares of flame set and cut into the ether. Here's our poetry... for we have pulled down the stars to our will." Johanna turns. Faces him.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANNA
dialogues.text: That's very beautiful. Is it yours? W.F. Ezra Pound.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANNA
dialogues.text: I'm Johanna. W.F. Ahh, Johanna. Yes, I assumed it was you.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANNA
dialogues.text: Have we met? W.F. No but I know you very well. W.F. looks right at her. Piercing.

dialogues.speaker: W.F., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're every girl I've ever loved and every girl that's ever rejected me.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANNA
dialogues.text: This conversation is growing strange. His piercing eyes. Even tone. Dead serious... W.F. I know you're having your fun. He's young and he's easy. But you'll have me to deal with if he scars. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Johanna's face forms a plastic smile. She speaks through

dialogues.speaker: JOHANNA
dialogues.text: I don't like strange conversations so I'm going to walk away now. Johanna slowly walks away from W.F. who watches her every graceful step. INT. THE RAINBOW ROOM вЂ” LATER Mimi talks with a FEMALE AUTHOR she admires as Thomas tak in the whole party. Mimi grabs him into a hug and kisses on the lips. A quick one. It catches him off guard.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: I just met J.T. Leroy. This is so much fun.

dialogues.speaker: AND THOMAS
dialogues.text: admiring her youthful giddiness. Drinking in its intoxication. As she takes him by the hand.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Dance with me, Thomas Webb.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Nobody's dancing. She leads him in front of the band.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: I know. And they dance to a slow number. Swaying back and forth i good cadence with each other. She whispers into his ear.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How long have you wanted me?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Since the moment you recommended "Taps At Reveille."

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: That was the day we met. Thomas slowly confirms this. Then...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Are you going to Croatia? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Do you want me to stay? She stops dancing.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll stay, Thomas. And she kisses him. This time it's a longer one.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you want me to. Thomas looks to Mimi but over her shoulder... standing alone... staring right at them... Johanna. Thomas locks eyes with Johanna, then back to Mimi.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: You have to excuse me. Thomas breaks their embrace. Leaves a confused and hurt Mimi. Walks quickly toward Johanna... and past her. As he passes.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I need to talk to you. INT. KITCHEN вЂ” NIGHT Johanna follows Thomas in.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANNA
dialogues.text: I have to talk to you as well.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: You're destroying my family. He glares at her.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What happened to you? Somewhere in your life, you... I don't know, lost your way. Why are you so... It trails off. Until...

dialogues.speaker: JOHANNA
dialogues.text: Yes, Thomas? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Inhuman.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANNA
dialogues.text: Maybe I didn't lose my way -- maybe I had it taken from me.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: You were... abused. She looks away and slowly nods.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. And she cracks into a smile. And laughs.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is something funny?

dialogues.speaker: JOHANNA
dialogues.text: Yes. You, Thomas. Your clichГ©d world. Your black and white existence. Your seat in the first row of psychology one-o-one and your hand raised so excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: You weren't abused.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANNA
dialogues.text: No, Thomas. But I've been overcharged before so maybe that's why I donвЂ™t wear white. He glares at her. Hurt.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANNA
dialogues.text: I am who I am. He moves toward her -- determined.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I want you out of our lives. I thought I loved you but you can't be loved. (and then) (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: You're sick and you lie and you seduce and God made a mistake when he made you beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANNA
dialogues.text: Are you finished? He takes a breath, thinks about it, then...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANNA
dialogues.text: I'm sorry you feel that way.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Well, I do. As Johanna lets out a superficial sigh...

dialogues.speaker: JOHANNA
dialogues.text: Well, you surely won't be the first little boy who hates his stepmother.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JOHANNA
dialogues.text: That's right, Thomas. Your father and I are to get married. He proposed to me yesterday. Thomas violently shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: No, he's going through a mid-life crises. You're a symptom... you're not permanent.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANNA
dialogues.text: But I am. He's leaving your mother. That's why he wants you to live closer to home. Thomas stands in shock

dialogues.speaker: JOHANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It was his decision. See, despite everything... She draws in a long drag. Then... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOHANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can be loved.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: What do you think is going to happen? That you guys are going to get married, have the obligatory second family and live happily ever after?

dialogues.speaker: JOHANNA
dialogues.text: Well, that obviously can't happen.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: What is that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: JOHANNA
dialogues.text: Think about it. He stands there, very befuddled.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: You're infertile? And she says it very slowly.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANNA
dialogues.text: No. Johanna turns to go but Thomas grabs her by the arm... tu her back around.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I'll tell him about us. I'll tell him everything!

dialogues.speaker: JOHANNA
dialogues.text: I don't think you have the balls Let's face it... you're not your father. As she rips away from his grasp... INT. THE RAINBOW ROOM вЂ” NIGHT Thomas returns to the party. He looks across the room to his mother being introduced to Johanna by another guest. And Thomas Webb can't take it anymore.  81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas rushes out of the building. Quickly walks down 5th Avenue. In the light drizzle of rain. Mimi emerges from the building and runs after him.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Thomas! Thomas! He stops and turns.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's raining. He nods. They hold the moment.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And I think I'm falling in love with you.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Shopenhauer was right, Mimi. Nothing we do matters.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: It's not true, Thomas. She steps toward him.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I slept with her. I slept with Johanna. Mimi stands still. In the rain. As her face washes white.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: And I thought I loved her.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: No. Thomas... your not like that You're good.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: No, Mimi, I'm not good. I'm just... And it trails off... and it rains... and she stands there (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Crushed, Mimi just looks at him. Tears being washed down face from the rain. And she turns around and runs. Thomas takes in a breath, then...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mimi... wait. He runs after her. Runs in the rain down 5th Avenue and catches her, turns her around.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mimi, you're all I wanted. Her mascara running down her face.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Let me go! I thought you were someone else. But you're just like them.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Mimi, please...

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: They've won, Thomas... they've bankrupted you. She rips away from him, flags down a cab. And he lets her go. EXT. CENTRAL PARK вЂ” NIGHT Under the light rain, Thomas walks into the park And he walks. And it rains. And he walks. Until Thomas stops. He stops and simply stands there... a lets the sky piss down on him. EXT. CENTRAL PARK вЂ” MORNING Thomas awakens on a bench. As he stands and stretches. INT. METROPOLITAN MUSEUM вЂ” MORNING Wet and dirty, Thomas stares at Rodin's "Hand Of God." He doesn't move. As a TOUR GUIDE brings through a group of about fifteen CHILDREN. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TOUR GUIDE
dialogues.text: Rodin had a deep knowledge of the art of the Middle Ages and the Renaissance. (a beat) People have debated since its creation whether this hand of God is coddling the man and woman or whether it's about to squeeze them. Thomas loudly exclaims.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: It's about to squeeze them.

dialogues.speaker: TOUR GUIDE
dialogues.text: Well, that's the debate. Thomas turns to the group of children...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: No debate... it's about to squeeze the shit out of them. Tour Guide regards Thomas then smiles over to her group..

dialogues.speaker: TOUR GUIDE
dialogues.text: Okay, let's move on to the French Impressionists. INT. WEBB'S RIVERSIDE DRIVE BROWNSTONE/KITCHEN вЂ” DAY Judith smokes. She's frantic.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: He left early this morning. He said he had to get some files from the office.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I need to talk to him. Judith regards her son.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: What's going on, Thomas?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Nothing, Mom. I just need his advice on something. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: Father, son stuff?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Right. This makes her smile.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: I've planned a trip to Grand Caymen. He needs it. He's most at peace when he's diving.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I don't know if that-- She interrupts her son.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: Oh, but don't tell him... I want it to be a surprise. She's giddy with her plan. Thomas capitulates to her mani

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I won't, Mom. EXT. KENTA-WEBB OFFICES вЂ” DAY Thomas stands with a SECURITY GUARD outside the offices.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: It's Sunday.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I know but I think my father came in to get some files.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: I'll have to escort you in. INT. NATHAN'S OFFICE вЂ” DAY Thomas stands with the Guard. Nobody is in the office. Thomas walks over to the desk. He looks at the pictures o it. Pictures taken throughout the years of Nathan and Judith. And pictures of Thomas from baby to present And he looks over to a corkboard wall where there are articles on Kenta-Webb and its rise with-in the publishin world. And Thomas' accomplishments and awards. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: I gotta lock up. Transfixed, Thomas slowly nods. But he sees something in of the pictures. He takes it off the board and looks at i intensely. We now see it.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS WINNING A TENNIS MATCH IN HIGH SCHOOL
dialogues.text: A long shot of him throwing his racket up in the air afte hitting the winning point. And in the crowd, behind Thoma stands W.F. Gerald. Younger but it's clearly him. Shocked, Thomas shoves the picture in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas bangs on W.F.'s door. No answer

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Where the fuck are you? He kicks it. Kicks again. Asks a different question.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who the fuck are you? EXT. JOHANNA'S SPRING STREET LOFT вЂ” DAY Thomas frantically rings the button. As the door buzzes. INT. JOHANNA'S SPRING STREET LOFT/HALLWAY вЂ” DAY Thomas bangs on the door. It opens. Nathan stands there.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Thomas, come in. INT. JOHANNA'S LOFT вЂ” DAY Nathan leads Thomas in.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Dad, I can explain how I knew you were here.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: There's no need. I know everything.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: You know everything? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to drag you through this.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: What did she say?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: You shouldn't have had to find out that way.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: What did she say? Nathan sighs and has a seat.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
